item.title: U.S. ski resorts are bracing for a steep drop in international travel due to politics
item.description: Canadians usually head south for the skiing, shopping and nightlife in American ski towns. But due to cross-border politics, tourism to the U.S. is down, and some resorts are worried.

item.description: The U.S. Transportation Department is threatening to shut down thousands of truck driving schools and trainers, part of the Trump administration's widening crackdown on industry.

item.title: This Colorado city is trying to make public planning meetings more fun and engaging
item.description: City planning meetings are important, but they can be very boring. To encourage input, Boulder, Colorado, is letting the public add photos and other media to an interactive map of changes they want.

item.title: Afghan suspect in D.C. National Guard attack appeared to suffer personal crisis
item.description: Rahmanullah Lakanwal, an Afghan national, is accused of shooting two National Guard soldiers on Nov. 26. One of those soldiers, 20-year-old Sarah Beckstrom, died from her wounds.

item.title: From subways to galleries: Miami's Museum of Graffiti traces the appeal of street art
item.description: A new show at Miami's Museum of Graffiti traces the origins and development of street art. What began in the 1970s with teenagers tagging New York subway cars has grown into a worldwide art movement.

item.title: Fired worker sues government in a case that could upend civil rights laws
item.description: A fired immigration judge says she was dismissed from her job because of her gender, her status as a dual citizen of Lebanon and the fact that she once ran for municipal office in Ohio as a Democrat.

item.title: U.S. tightens immigration after National Guard shooting. And, latest on Ukraine talks
item.description: The White House is moving swiftly to tighten legal immigration reviews after two National Guard members were shot last week. And, Ukraine enters a new round of negotiations to end the war with Russia.

item.title: Trump administration halts asylum decisions as legal migration crackdown intensifies
item.description: The Trump administration is intensifying its efforts to restrict legal migration, pausing all asylum decisions after an Afghan national was charged in the attack on two National Guard members.
